Use candles: Candles are a classic and timeless solution to lighting up a room at night. They can create a warm and cozy atmosphere, and come in a variety of scents and sizes to suit different moods and preferences.

Use natural light: If the room has windows, opening them to let in the natural light can be an effective way to light up the room during the day. This can be especially helpful during the winter months when the days are shorter.
Use glow-in-the-dark paint: Glow-in-the-dark paint can be used to paint the walls or ceilings of a room, creating a soft and ethereal glow that can be used to light up the room at night.

Use solar panels: Solar panels can be installed on the roof of the room to harness the power of the sun and use it to light up the room at night. This can be an eco-friendly solution that can help reduce energy costs over time.

Use a flashlight: A flashlight can be used to light up the room at night. There are many different types of flashlights available, including handheld, wall-mounted, and ceiling-mounted options, so it's important to choose the one that best suits your needs.
